Hi Amy,

Thanks for sending these details.

Confirming we have updated the site.

  1. Safari issue with logo being cut off is still happening on all other pages (see screenshot below), homepage is fixed. Done
  2. Pacific House This should say next not previous down the bottom as its the first project to view. Done
  3. The Chambers When you click next on this one, it should go to Kilmory not Pacific House. And so on... Done
  4. Project slider on the HP > please have the next and previous also appearing in the white gaps too please Done
  5. Newsletter footer sign up > clicking on the arrow doesn't work.. looks like the click is under the arrow > please fix Done
  6. Also newsletter success does not match live site. Done
  7. Email subjects for each form. Done

Let me know if this works for you?

Thanks,

Hi  Joel @wolfiq

The following list has been updated. Only the Dinkel Logo needs extra checking—it may be reflecting differently on your end. On my end, the issue isn’t showing, but I adjusted the size to be safe. Please verify how it appears on your side. Other than that, all adjustments are good to go—please verify on your end.

(Time: 40mins)

-LJ

Also sorry really quick Q from the client for the contact form:

Is it possible to have the email subjects for these different enquiry submissions say what they are? ie New Careers Form... New Press form... New Project Enquiry?

Let us know :)

Hi Amy,

Thanks for sending through the details, happy to confirm we’ve now updated the site

Here’s a quick rundown of everything addressed:

Updates completed
  • Logo being cut off on Safari - fixed ✅
  • Project page navigation — corrected so Previous / Next now behave as expected across all projects ✅
  • Project page carousel navigation - hover state improved and now activates within the white margins between images ✅
  • Contact form success message - updated to:
    “Thank you for your interest. Our team will be in contact shortly.” ✅
  • Newsletter sign-up styling - now matches the contact form (grey placeholder text, black entered text) ✅
  • Flodesk - confirmed that press and career enquiries do not enter the Flodesk flow ✅
  • Mobile hero image - the attached image is being used as-is and no filter has been applied on mobile ✅
Project sorting
  • You can reorder projects via drag-and-drop here: https://jilliandinkelcom.wolfiq.cloud/wp-admin/edit.php?post_type=project
  • Just hover over a row and drag it into your preferred order.

Quick links for review
  • https://jilliandinkelcom.wolfiq.cloud/
  • https://jilliandinkelcom.wolfiq.cloud/project/
  • https://jilliandinkelcom.wolfiq.cloud/project/kilmory/
  • https://jilliandinkelcom.wolfiq.cloud/enquire/

Ahead of going live, we’ll just need FTP/SFTP access.

We generally recommend hosting with us, as it allows for smoother deployments, more efficient updates, and better visibility around performance and ongoing maintenance, especially if anything needs quick attention. As the site includes custom code, this level of access helps ensure we can properly maintain, update, and support the site over time. That said, we’re happy either way and can work with whichever hosting setup.

And to confirm for Jill, yes, we can absolutely assist with:
  • Hotjar
  • Google Analytics
  • Google Search Console
  • Page speed and performance guidance

Please let us know once you’ve had a chance to review, or if anything else needs a final tweak. We’re keen to help get this over the line smoothly.

Thanks,

Hi @wolfiq (Joel)

Please help to verify the ff items are adjusted on the staging
here's my feedback on each item as well
https://app.clickup.com/t/86d01gd5m?comment=90160153413877

(Time :  90mins)

-LJ

Forgot one extra thing sorry!
The client would like to be able to reorder the projects so when she loads in a new project its at the top not the bottom of the list. Can you please assist with this?

Thank you,
Amy

Hey Team,

Unfortunately they have a few more things > see below:


  1. Logo being cut off still on safari browsers

  2. Project Page Navigation is backwards when you click on the first project, it should say 'next'. When you click on the second project, clicking previous takes you to the next one instead of back, and next takes you back. The final project should also say previous.

  3. Project Pages- carousel navigation of more images - sometimes its hard to see the Previous / Next Hover state CTA > can the hover state be activated in the white margins between the images?


  4. Contact Form success page- Should read: Thank you for your interest. Our team will be in contact shortly.

  5. Newsletter sign up: Should follow same convention as the Contact form- suggestive text in grey, entered text in black

  6. Flodesk > Can you confirm that anyone filling out for a press enquiry or career enquiry don;t go into this flow?

  7. Mobile: The hero image on mobile only seems to have a greyed out filter on it. Can you please check?



Would it please be ok to have this finished within 24 hours as we're really pushing to have this be handed over and live before we break for the year.

Also update on hosting > the client is going to keep greengeeks but use the support maintenance we've paid for with you, so we'll introduce you to Jill when we organise go live.
Do you need anything from greengeeks for when this new staging environment goes live?

Jill wants to clarify that your team will be able to help with: Things such as Hotjar, Google Analytics, Google Search Console and advising on our page speed and performance?

Look forward to hearing from you.

Kindest,
Amy

Hi Amy, Thanks for reaching out about this one. Got your note regarding the hosting dates - no worries at all. To clarify the timeline for the 6 months you have paid upfront:
  • This period will run from December through to May.
  • From June onwards, the billing will switch over, and the Jillian Dinkel team will be billed directly.
Let me know if you need anything else. Cheers, Victoria Wolf IQ Accounts Team 1300 072 134 accounts@wolfiq.com.au

Hi Amy,

Thanks for this — happy to share an update!

  • Yes, the current live site is still hosted on GreenGeeks.
  • To give a clearer picture, here’s the difference between the live site and our WolfiQ staging site:

Current Live
  • We’re unable to get a proper PageSpeed/Core Web Vitals scan because of the current server setup, so the results aren’t reliable.
  • This makes it a bit tricky to get an accurate “before” baseline from the live environment.

Wolfiq Staging
  • The staging environment is fully scannable and performing really well.
  • It’s currently scoring 95 on Performance, with strong results across all other metrics too.
  • This gives us a solid reference point so that once everything goes live on Kinsta, we can run another scan and clearly measure the improvements.

Once the move to Kinsta is complete and the updated site is live, we’ll run a fresh set of Core Web Vitals so the client can see the full before-and-after impact.

Let me know if this works for you, or if you'd like me to look into anything else.

Thanks, that looks good! We're so close!
The client has a couple of questions for you - see below:


  • Is the live site currently still sitting with greengeeks? If so...

  • Can you please have Wolfiq run core web vitals now (before go live), so we can get a baseline of how the site is performing now, and once we are live with the changes and with WolfIQ they can run another core web vitals so we can measure the changes?



Let me know if thats possible.

Kindest,
Amy

Homepage

Profile Page
  • We are adjusting the padding and spacing on the Profile Page as requested to improve the visual layout.

Please let us know if you have any questionsx.
